info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 9 at 12:38AM EDT until June 9 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following county, Lunenburg.
* WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area through 115 AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Victoria, Lunenburg, Rehoboth, Kells Corner, Loves Mill, Pleasant Grove, Plantersville, Blevins Corner, Oral Oaks, Gary and Fort Mitchell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not stay in areas subject to flooding when water begins rising.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
